content.detailedDescription: Me and my mother was at the firework show in lancaster ohio. about 30 minutes before the fire works start (around 9:30ish) me and my mom saw this floating orange ball in the sky, the glowing of the orange ball was pulsating, we spotted it from a distance as it moved closer to us, still with the orange glow pulsating. we knew it had to have been moderately high in the air because the object kept going behind clouds that appeared to be very high in the sky, and you could still see the glow (faintly) behind the clouds. it was moving in and out of the clouds. witnesses beside us said it was a candle tied to a balloon, or a japanese lantern, which i started to think "oh yeah that makes sense" but, the orange ball continued to pulsate and then the orange ball started slowly dimming, which i thought was the candle going out due to lack of oxygen. the weird thing was though that as soon as the orange glow went out there was a bright blue flash immediately followed by a bright white flash, (and the flashes werent like the flash of a firework) the object disappeared for a minute, then the orange glow reappeared and continued to pulsate again for a few minutes. as it was approaching above our heads, the object stopped glowing, but you could see the silhouette of the object in front of the blue sky. it looked like an oddly shaped blimp or something, still hovering above us. then it floated out of sight. i thought maybe i was crazy or hallucinating  but my mom saw the exact same thing i saw, we thought there was another explanation until the blue and white flashes. we would have recorded a video but my moms phones battery was dead. there may have been more witnesses due to the large crowd of people at the fairgrounds for the fireworks, and people all over lancaster watching fireworks.
content.summary: Floating orb that glowed pulsating orange, stoped glowing, emitted white/blue flash,  glowing reappeared, then went out.

content.detailedDescription: I thought that the activity was over but after reporting my sightings of the five, or two, crafts, i thought the activity was over. i went in to report those. afterward i can back outside and at 12:24am i looked straight up and there was another star moving. it fired two bursts of, whatever they do, and it moved northward across the night sky until it disappeared or faded out . . . or . . . whatever it is they do. just seems like the activity is picking up like last year about this time when i had over 33 sightings between june 27th and november 3rd. keep looking up in the sky redding.
content.summary: A star craft; two bursts and it was gone

content.detailedDescription:
After driving my babysitter home i was returning to my house via the largest hill in town.  halfway down the hill the trees open up and you can see the sky and mountain of the horizon very clearly.  i looked up and saw, just over the horizon, 5 red balls of light and immediately thought they were the fireworks of a 4th of july celebration from the next town over.  i stopped my car to watch, but quickly realized that these ���fireworks��� were not descending after their apparent explosion, they were stationary in the sky.  i watched for about 1 minute before i put the car in park and got out to really get a closer look.  there was about 5 red glowing balls of light (looking like firework sparks, or a flare).  the one closest to the middle of the group was the only one stationary.  there were two above and to the right, one below and to the left, and one farthest one below and to the right.  the one below and to the right was moving very slowly out of my view and eventually i could not see it anymore.  this left only 4 now.  after about 10 minutes one of the top balls got very bright and disappeared.  this left only 3.  the one in the middle still did not move, while the other two kept hovering around it and ���checking in with it��� almost like how a parent doesn���t let his kids stray to far.  the ���roaming two��� dots would move left to right, up and down in a very fluid but slow motion, but always returned to vicinity of the middle ���mothership��� ( i use that term very loosely).
the behavior of the dots was odd.  they would periodically disappear, separately, and then reappear.  the would get very bright, separately, and then dim out to almost nothing. and once they all got very bright simultaneously and then dimmed to their regular brightness. the entire event lasted about 40 minutes, for me.  i had even left to go home and get my camera, and when i returned and the lights were still there!  i could get no image with the camera because it was not a good enough one.  the lights were very close to the horizon.  i tried to find another place in town where i could see that part of the sky, but could not find any.  when i could stay no more, cause it was getting late and i told my wife i was going for ���icecream��� when i went back to get my camera, they were still sitting in the sky.
content.summary: 5 starlike ufo's

content.detailedDescription: Was out in front parking lot facing south talking to a friend on cell (was looking at building lights that i just turned on, ciurcut breaker popped off) when this orange red large light in the clouds caught my attention. it was a solid color no other lights or blinking lights, heading from the west to east. it took about 5 to 8 seconds flying over head as it past it turned black and i could then see it was circular in shape against the clouds. a few seconds later a plane flew over head it's lights blinking and smaller than object,also made noise which then made me realise that the orange red light was silent
content.summary: Orange red circular object

content.detailedDescription:
Sitting on the balcony enjoying a cigarette on a chill but clear night with a friend.
above the tree line heading w > e a bright and very red singular light spotted moving slowly north from us. about as bright and the same size as a burning cigarette held at arms length.
first thought it was the iss which we regularly observe. realised that a, it was much redder than usual and b. moving a lot slower in the sky than usually seen. appeared to be much lower in altitude than other satellites also regularly observed. 
just after losing sight behind our roof we checked the real-time iss tracker which indicated it was just off the chilean coast, so discount the iss.
it was moving slowly enough to allow time to get a good view through binoculars by two people. no distinct shape, but bright. twice as bright as any other celestial object we are familiar with. also no other light sources, no aviation lights, beacons, etc. slow and steady movement.
we have a good elevated view from the western horizon to just past directly overhead. this red light source took at least one minute to pass our viewable area and it wasn't initially spotted till it was 20deg or so above the horizon, so it took just over a min to pass through approx 70deg.
we are logical ufo believers and sit out nightly observing anything in the sky and this was the most anomalous sighting we've had.
we are close to flight paths to sydney airport and easily can see approaches from the south and west. this was not an aircraft.
unusual indeed!
content.summary: Bright red light, slow moving.

content.detailedDescription: After watching fireworks me and my wife notice what we thought was a cinder in the sky, but after watching it for a few minutes we noticed it wasn't moving by the time i got to an area to record it it had disappeared.I discussed it at work with some coworkers and thy saw it to one guys kid saw it and he used his smart phone to see what it was using a sky map and said it was saturn.I have never seen anything like this before it's the same object that everyone on ufo tracker app is seeing some of the pictures and videos are exactly the same object
content.shape: Egg,   Fireball,   Oval,   Saturn-like,   Star-like,   Unknown
content.summary: Orange oblong stationery ball

content.detailedDescription: We were sitting outside enjoying the evening on the fourth of july with friends having a barbeque.  i looked up into the shy and i say a black circular disc moving from the southeast to the northwest.  at first sight i thought it was a balloon, but it did not ascend at all, it was gliding like a jet, below the clouds.  it looked like a hockey puck, but as it was so far away, it was much larger than that.  there were no lights, and we followed it until it left our sight in front of the san bernardino mountains
content.summary: Matte black disc

content.detailedDescription: While by the high school sports complex,i observed a bright yellow ball of light to the west ascend into the air at about a 50 degree angle, like a plane taking off. the first thought that came to mind was that it was a plane because of the angle of ascent. i then changed my mind because saw now flashing red light, nor did i hear any sound whatsoever. i could tell that it was not yet at a high altitude because it was against the mountain, not the sky, at first. it climbed in a south-easterly direction. when it seemed to be at a steady altitude, it changed direction, heading east. it cleared the valley in a about 15 to 20 seconds, pulsated very slowly about three times, and disappeared. to say the least, i felt a rush of excitement and confusion at the same time.
content.summary: Bright ball of light ascended against the mountain and continued eastbound, pulsated and disappeared.

content.detailedDescription:
At first i sensed movement north of ursa major. as i off focused a bit the faint "star" that was motionless began movement and became brighter moving through the northernmost part of the constellation. the time was 10:25pm when it began. 

but right before the event there were two flashes of light that at first i thought were meteors but their pattern were too close in shape and brightness. plus they moved parallel from each other. anyway, back to the event . . . even if this is part of it too...

as it moved through the the "kettle" of the dipper the star craft changed direction but not as in linear movement. it was more like it went with the curve of the sky as opposed to a jet in our atmosphere moving linearly. the star appeared bright with a center of blue but it was high in altitude. it appeared to completely change direction but perhaps in star movement it really isn't.

at 10:47pm this same star like craft with blue in the center moved from south to north bright at first but then it faded but at 10:53 the same celestial moved across from the direction i last saw it in the north moving south. it was brighter than before but made slow movements. i believe that possibly it may be the same craft doing sweeps because right around 10:57pm . . .

the brightest star came into view. the brightness star lights were in the shape of the two quick lights that illuminated a huge saucer shaped domed craft. i say it must have been huge because where it was in the sky must have been far up in the atmosphere. but as i saw the craft, it did what it always does and that is cloak themselves or they transform somehow . . . these are my observations . . . after the bright craft the star light, blue centered one appeared and generally moved in the direction of the large one.

i sense that something is happening tonight july 5th either here in the west or they are moving south south east . . . perhaps towards arizona, nevada maybe . . . something is up. i will observe more and report them.
content.summary: Five or just one? . . . stars moving in all directions

content.detailedDescription: My boyfriend was outside smoking and called my daughter and i outside because he was seeing something strange in the sky over missoula.  we are avid sky watchers so i ran outside and saw that it was not a normal light in the sky so i ran back inside to grab my camera so i could video it.  it was a very bright, fire-orange light that seemed to travel horizontally at first, and then it started to go up horizontally until it disappeared.  it seemed cigar shaped and there were no flashers like airplanes have. the fire-orange light around it was very bright and was tons bigger than any stars in the sky. there was also no sound.  we were very excited to see it. the video i got does not do it justice.  it was way bigger than it shows and does not show the fire-orange light around it very well.  maybe with the technology you have access to you will see something.
content.summary: Bright, fire-orange cigar shaped object ove missoula, mt.

content.detailedDescription:
1.  i was in my swimming pool with my two children at about 9 pm.

2.  my 6 year old daughter pointed it out to me and said 'look its a space shuttle'.

3.  i was not wearing my glasses so i grabbed them and was able to see the object clearly for about half the time.  it was curious because i could see no wings and there was no noise.  

4.  it was a white cigar shaped object from my perspective.  my 7 year old son, who has much better vision than i do, said it had three windows.  i had him draw a picture of the object.  his picture was similar to my recollection but a bit more saucer shaped.  the object was clearly visible but not flying low, i would guess it to be 500 ft in the air but i have no perspective to quantify that, there were no clouds in the sky to give perspective.  it was a very bright white color but the sun was setting so it may have been reflecting the last rays of the sun.  it reminded me of a blimp but it appeared to be going much faster than that.  it was travelling from the north to the south.  the object was to the east of us so it would have been in the right perspective to reflect the suns last rays at that particular moment.

5.  my daughter was just getting out of the pool and i did not want to startle her but after she was out of earshot, i told my son that it was very curious what we saw.  we both thought it was very cool, we were definitely more curious than scared.  my son asked me who could be piloting it, i told him i don't know. he surmised that it was 'aliens' and wondered what they were doing.  i did not coach him on his response but thought it was an appropriate response.

6.  it flew over the trees and out of sight.
content.summary: White cigar shaped object without wings moving silently in southerly direction

content.detailedDescription: In the early morning of july 4, 2011, on the south side of jackson state park resovoir is a private r.V. community, approximately 15 people were sitting outside and witnessed a bright red ufo that appeared to be two balls one on top of each other, it proceeded to the north and faded out of sight, aproximately 5 minutes later it appeared again in the north site for a moment. one of our party who was not present, showed shortly after this and he said he was walking on the main road leading into the park and had seen the object as well. after discussing what he saw, me and 4 other people went to the road to see if we could see anything else. we went up to the road and after we had been their for a short time, my fiance looking toward the south saw another bright red object approaching, we had a clear view of the the sky from the north to the south and the object flew directly over us at aproximately 12,000 feet, having viewed commerical jet liners and military air craft in flight, i estimated it was traveling a aproximately 1200 miles per hour due to the time it took it to travel across the entire horizon, it was bright ruby red and when directly above us appeared almost crystaline with difused red light waves around it. after it faded off in the distance, some minutes later while watching to see if we could see anything further, we saw to objects the at first appeared to be stars moving in a synchonise manner off to the north as well, they were white balls and where about the same luminosity as the stars appearing behind them. after this we went to the lakeshore and were on the south west side of the lake and saw a bright white light over the lake as we watched it moved toward the north east and faded out of sight very quickly. i served 4 years in the usaf and have seen numerous aircraft both at night and during the day in flight and what i saw was like nothing i have seen before. i have had two other sightings in my life and this was the most intense and clear cut, that and with the other witnesses that were with me has led me to know beyond all certainty that we are not alone in the universe and our government is lying to us and it is the greatest conspiracy in the world.  if only we would have had a video camera. the other sightings i have had were outside of grand junction colorado in 1997 were i saw a triangular green ufo that was hovering over a ranch and that followed me car for about 20 miles and in ellettsville, in. in 1987 i saw a huge glowing orange red ball of light as well.H
content.summary: Ruby red ufo flys over jackson state park

content.detailedDescription: The weather was clear but hazy due to high humidity - temp was approx 70 and the air was calm/still. i arrived home just before 9.30 pm after     spending the afternoon in my canoe on the river. i was disconnecting the trailer off my truck when a firework went off in the sky which i glanced up at. two dots caught my attention and i thought they were part of the firework "burst" but then i realized they were not fading nor moving. they appeared almost to the due east of my location and were approx 45 degrees inclination to the horizon. i have quite a wide experiance with aviation and amatuer astronomy and expected the dots to eventually turn like a plane would if it was heading straight towards or away from you but they remained in the same position. the dots were about the same brightness as the brighest star but larger than a star and not a clear white "dot" but fuzzy and an orange color - maybe 3 or 4 times the diameter of a star - perhaps the size of a matchstick head held at arms length. the dots were not a clear white light like navigation lights and there was no strobe affect that you would see from nav lights - during the whole sighting several different aircraft traversed the sky and this was unlike any of them. i continued to watch them for perhaps a minute and realized that this was different from anything i have ever seen and went to my truck to get my cell phone to video it. by the time i got back (maybe 20 seconds) they had both disappeared. i figured it was something "strange" and went back to taking the trailer off my truck. i looked up again after a couple of minutes and there was one dot - the same size, intensity and color as before in approximately the same location. this i captured on tape. you will see in the video 2 bright lights at the bottom of the frame - those are deck lights on houses approx 50 yards from where i was standing - the unexplained dots are in the mid frame. while i was taping the lights two of my neighbors walked by going to watch the fireworks and i asked them if they could see the lights (you can hear part of our conversation on the tape). they said they could see the same thing and they had been watching them for about the same time as i had. they also said they had both never seen anything like it.  after a few minutes the dot blinked out again. my neighbors walked off to watch the fireworks which started and lasted for about 25 minutes. after the fireworks were over for 5 minutes or so i again saw 2 dots the same size, color etc as before in the same location which i captured on the second video - they moved a small amount towards the north east but i only realized that after reviewing the video and seeing their position in relationship to the 2 lights on my neighbors houses.  after a few minutes they blinked out again seperately within approximately 15 seconds of each other. again after a few minutes one appeared the same size, brightness, location which was also witnessed by my same neighbors returning home who i had talked to earlier and again they agreed it was very unusual and they have "never seen anything like it" after a few minutes it "blinked" out meaning it disappered and reappeared and disappeared again over the course of 5 to 10 seconds.  i continued to watch the sky for 15 minutes or so and then went into the house. during the whole episode i felt excited about what i was seeing and at no time did i feel fear or apprehension - the lights seemed very distant although i cannot give an altitude - i would say they were in our atmosphere but that is just a guess. these lights were many times brighter than satellites which i have seen crossing the sky before. i consider myself to be level headed, practical, logical and not prone to the dramatic or speculation. i have no idea what the lights were but i have never seen anything like it before.
content.summary: I saw 2 blurry orange dots that disappeared and reappeared over the course of an hour .

content.detailedDescription:
my wife and i were taking our evening walk when we noticed an airliner taking off from harlingen international airport.  the plane was already flying over north 77 sunshine strip and was directly over us heading west.  we walk the industrial park across the street from our house for exercise.  as we made our way across the street and into the park.  we noticed another plane or airliner taking off and also heading west in the same direction as the previous one.  from our viewpoint the first plane was to the right of the "star" and the one that just took off was to the left of the "star".  i say "star" because that is what it appeared to be at first glance.  

  after staring at the "star" for a few seconds we noticed it was moving heading towards us in an eastern direction towards the airport.  assuming that the "star" was an incoming aircraft. i turned to my wife and said that seems dangerous because i have never seen them group planes this close before in our area.  after both planes heading west were in the clear we observed the star or white light coming toward us and almost over us.  we looked for the faa required lights or some blinking lights but there were none on the object.  as it approached us i noticed it seemed to waiver or sway back and forth a  bit erratic.  we also observed that the object made no sound.  at this point the object began to change direction and head south.  it took a slight curve to the south and in a matter of three seconds it sped up and disappeared.  it's speed could be compared to that of letting the air out of a balloon.  that is how fast the light shrunk and disappeared.  no faa lights and no sound got me thinking on what this object was but when it took off like that and went out of sight.  i knew my wife and i had just seen a ufo. 

  i thought about calling the airport to see if they had any close calls involving aircraft or any odd hits on their radar but the only number listed is for customer service and not the tower. i decided to submit this report because about two months ago around dusk.  my wife and i were getting ready for our usual walk and she saw a white light in the sky with no faa lights either.  which also was heading east and then erratically changed it's course and flew south.  the way it changed it's course all of a sudden convinced my wife that she has just seen a ufo. i don't know the proper channels in contacting the pilots in those two aircraft heading west out of h.I.A.  but they had to had seen something.  the sky was clear and there was no clouds.
content.summary: Star like craft viewed flying in between two airliners or planes.

content.detailedDescription:
I was standing in my backyard looking at my neighbors shooting off fireworks. it was fairly bright out still.  i noticed that this one bright, orange light didn't diminish after a volley of firework projectiles. it was in the south-eastern sky and hovered there for a minute.  it was quite far off, though very bright. it appeared to be disc shaped, though with something on the top and bottom.  it was too far off for me to capture it on my camera phone. throughout this time (~30 secs) and until the end, there were no fireworks going off in the sky.  as it moved from east to west (against the prevailing wind currents) i noticed another, identical object moving into my field of vision through the trees, following the other light. a moment later, i saw another object move into my field of vision, except it was red. they slowly passed through what i could see of the sky through the trees. some friends that were coming over from the west end of town saw just one of the orange lights, but said it looked like some sort of flying saucer that was tilted. my neighbor, along with her elderly mother saw essentially the same scene that i described, except they said they saw that at one point the lights disappeared. 

at first i thought the lights were balloons or fireworks but they persisted and stayed constant.  they were also going against the prevailing wind and emitting far too much light to be a small, unmanned hot air balloon.

i lost sight of the objects when they went through the trees and i could no longer find them.
content.summary: Colored balls

content.detailedDescription: My husband and i were setting off fireworks in front of our home, many others in the neighborhood were as well.  suddenly my husband yelled for me to look up and pointed out something very odd, we saw a large orange-reddish colored 'orb' moving from south to north, below the clouds but above the mountain range.  it was moving in very quick, but steady fashion.  it was definatley not an airplane, falling star or a firework, impossible. we ran down the street so we could continue to view it, after just a few minutes it disappeared into the distance.
content.summary: We saw an orange-reddish colored object going north

content.detailedDescription: My family was outside at around 8 pm when we noticed this solid black triangle shaped object in the sky above we observed it for about 30 min it stayed stationary it appeared to be spinning. after the 30 minutes it began moving east slowy it made no noise. was not a ballon because it was moving against the wind and it was not and aircraft because there where planes in the sky and they looked nothing like the object. it stopped and remained stationary for about 15 min after about 45 minutes it dissapeard as the sun went down
content.summary: Matte black, no lights , stationary ,no noise,

content.detailedDescription: My fiancee, a friend and i were sitting on top of a hill at valencia blvd and mcbean pkwy waiting for 4th of july fireworks to start. at 9:05pm were scanning the sky looking for fireworks when i noticed 4 orange orbs in the sky flying over a mountain range belonging to the west end of the angeles national forest. at first i thought they were planes because of their speed, but then realized they were an odd color and had no flashing lights at all. they were flying north in a lopsided "v" formation with one in the front center, one on the left, and 2 on the right. after about a minute they slowly changed to a trapezoid formation, similar to the shape of the "big dipper" constellation but without the handle. as they continued flying north towards us, we noticed that the bottom-right orb in the formation started to dim, until it was so dim that it was not visible at all anymore. a few seconds later, the lower right orb began to fade until it was not longer visible as well. the last 2 orbs faded out one at a time as well, until nothing could be seen anymore. we were all very curious and interested, and baffled by what they could be. i can confidently rule out them being any form of commercial aircraft due to the lack of appropriate lights (and the fact that the lights went completely out). i cannot completely rule out the possibility that they were chinese lanterns, though the speed and seemingly deliberate formations give some evidence against the chinese lantern theory.
content.summary: 4 orange orbs near santa clarita

content.detailedDescription: My sons spotted it first then ran to tell their dad they see "something" in the sky. upon investigate dad discovered the object was not a reflection on the windows object was stationary for at least 4 minutes before vanishing.
content.summary: Bright object to the left of the moon. not moving just appeared then vanished 4 minutes later

content.detailedDescription: I had just picked up my wife from work and we were on our way home. we left sapulpa on route 66 heading west. we came to an intersection for highway 33 in between sapulpa and kellyville. right before we made the turn my wife noticed an orange orb with a red haze ring around it. the object was to the south. we turned onto highway 33 and pulled over to the side of the road to observe the object. the orb was coming from the kellyville direction and passed over highway 33 heading north. before it crossed the highway it decended a few feet and continued it's path north. when we first seen the object we thought it was a firework of some sort, but the object stayed in the air. the object continued north until it was out of sight. the object was in between a golf ball and tennis ball in size.
content.summary: Orange orb flys over highway on 4th of july.

content.detailedDescription: It was around 3:30 am i was smoking and watching the stars and planes in the south direction i seen a plane traveling thought the fight lanes than i notice a ball light get really bright as a plane aproch is the plane was travelin eat to west the ball of light had got really bright a than took off  to the north it disapeared but then came back to the exact same spot it hoverd there i than disapeared it travel so fast faster then anything i have ever seen i say the it was around 15000 to 20000 ft in the air.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Path with directional change
content.summary: Ball of light

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i were driving down shall rd we pulled up to the stop sign to take a right onto brandt pk. when we seen a low flying craft flying at tree top level about 400 yrds. flashing green red clearence lights.We turned right onto brandt and were going about 15 mph we pull up across from a texaco station i turned off the engine and we watched it.Then there were 2 very bright lights they looked so bright it looked like they were coming up the highway i was confused for a minite i thought they were truck lights or somethimg.There was a texaco highway sign about 50ft. in the air next to the highway the craft flew over that sign and stoped over the bridge about level with that sign. the craft pulled up and stoped as it stoped it rocked once then it was motionles.The craft was about 50yds.From us.The lights were facing down the highway west the craft turned and the lights was faceing at us we could not see anything i held my hands in frount of my face the hole area was as day light the craft turned again and the lights was faceing east it stayed ther for about 30 sec.Then turned floresent green i was very impressed and had good feeling and thought that is so impressive then it turned floresent red that was so scary.I though how big is this it covered the width of the bridge i looked over at the station and it it as big as that no sound just hung there in complete control.The event lasted about maby about 5 min.Then it flew off flaching green red green red. i said to my wife i just seen a ufo she said i did too we drove down turnened around and came down brandt again here it comes again. we pulled up to the same place again turn off the engine like befor its coming to us again there is  a car is comeing down the road behind us.It just went away.
content.flightPath: Stationary,Hovering then path,Straight-line path,Path with directional change
content.summary: As big as a gas station it changed colors from dark black to green then red

content.detailedDescription:
The fireball appeared in the southwestern sky and flew over stoney creek metro park right above the heads of many fireworks spectators who gapped in shock and some in fright. for five minutes people snapped photos of the ball of light. it finally disappeared to the east. many people talked about it soon after. we were at stoney creek metro park. i first noticed the object when i was watching the crowd and for some reason looked up.
at first i thought it was ball lightning because it happened during a thunderstorm but it acted unlike ball lightning. it seemed to take notice of the crowd and left its original course to fly toward us all. it moved smoothly through the air and seemed interested in the people. at that moment i felt true fear. soon though i felt that it would not harm anyone. after the sighting i felt relieved and filled with awe. i lost sight of the object when it crossed across the horizon.
content.summary: Small red ball headed northeast at 25 miles per hour

content.detailedDescription:
E-mail received by asd today in exact wording: 

hello,
 
last night about 10:30 pm two orange orbs were seen in my neighborhood (actually hovering approx. 200 feet above where we were shooting fireworks).  they were approx. 300 feet near my property.  there were several witnesses of the bright orbs.  i am a very spiritual person and i was not scarred at all.  the two orbs came from the east and hovered for approximately a minute and then drifted west and disappeared  the speed of the orbs was approx. like a small single engine plane.
------------------------
note from asd:  i interviewed the witness today and his further description is that the objects were white in the center with an orange glow, it would take two hands put together to cover the second orb at arm's length, and a large frisbee to cover the first orb at arm's length.  both objects started out moving faster, then slowed down.  they seemed to move in a straight-line path unaffected by the wind and did not bob up and down.  the wife was also a witness and she was talking in the background while i was on the phone and is in agreement. there were four neighbors who saw the objects as well.  they have all seen chinese lanterns and believe that these objects did not behave in the same manner. 

the kci airport is just west of their location and the flight path for planes is north to south.  there is a farm to their west
content.summary: Two large orange orbs joined together

content.detailedDescription:
As reported via e-mail to asd in their exact words:
 
i'm not sure what we saw, but i wanted to report this to someone who might be tracking this information closely.  my husband and i live on the southeast edge of pleasant hill, missouri which is about a 10-15 minute drive southeast of lee's summit, missouri.  we had just gotten back from watching the city firework show yesterday night (july 4, 2011), and my son and i were sitting on our back porch which faces to the southeast watching neighbors fireworks.  my husband was in the front of the house which faces to the northwest.
 
it was about 10:00 p.M. when my son asked what something was in the sky.  i looked and i saw a bright orange glow in the shape of a circle that was moving from the northeast to the southwest.  to me, it looked to be at about the height of our 2-story home and was moving very evenly on a linear track.  there was absolutely no sound.  at first i had thought it was a piece of firework debris that was on fire.  i watched it closely thinking that i didn't want it to land on the roof and catch our house on fire.  but then i realized that it was not bobbing up and down, or moving erratically like you would expect a piece of paper to do in the wind.  it was also not dying down, which you would expect a piece of paper on fire to do.  i began to think it was pretty odd, but didn't even think that it could be a ufo.  

about a minute later, my husband ran from the front of the house saying "do you see that!".  he does not believe in anything other-worldly, and believes that there is a very reasonable explanation to everything.  this had him stumped.  it continued to climb higher for about a minute and then it faded away.  it was hard to tell if it had just faded away or just got higher and we couldn't see it anymore.
 
one reason why i had initially thought it was a piece of paper on fire was that the glow was only on one side of the object.  not like a solid orb.  i felt that i had a pretty up close look at it, but then my husband thought that it was at an elevation similar to an airplane coming in for a landing.  we live in a somewhat rural area.  our property is about 2-acres, which is long and narrow and backs up to a tree line.  there would be no airplanes coming in for a landing there, nor are there any crops on the adjacent properties for crop dusters.  we live in a subdivision where everyone has about 2 to 4 acres of land, but it is only residentia
  
after that, we stood on our driveway facing to the west.  then we started to see about 8 or 9 of these same orange "orbs" on the western horizon.  this is when i realized something was very different.  they moved in the same manner, in a long steady, linear track but gradually got higher and higher.  the kind of flickered like balls that were on fire.   we saw about 5 or 6 that initially began in the northwest horizon (we were guessing over greenwood, mo or lee's summit, mo, but they could have been closer) and then tracked to the south.  we saw about 3 that initially began from the southwest and tracked to the north.  what was weird is that they all tracked to the exact location on the western horizon before they dissapated, including the first one that flew overhead.  it couldn't have been chinese lanterns because they flew in three different trajectories, some opposite of the wind last night which was from the east-southeast during that time.  the one that i saw up close was definitely not a chinese lantern.  also, they could not have been airplanes because of the first one that flew overhead did not make any noise, nor were there any noise lagging behind it like you would expect in a jet plane. 
 
one last thing, these must have been moving very, very fast based on the rate of where they moved on the horizon.  

i've never seen anything like this before, and neither has my husband.  we are stumped and cannot believe what we saw.  we did some research online last night and found that these same orange orbs are being documented around the country, including several last night during firework shows.  their videos look exactly like what we saw.  
 
we were able to catch some video of it.  but i'm not sure how good of quality it is. (note from fi: i am obtaining this video)
 
i hope this helps you in your research! i hope to some day understand what happened last night.
  
thanks for listening!


fi note: i spoke to the husband by phone today.  their 2-year old son saw a orb first and pointed it out to his mother. the father thought it might be a plane on fire at first. he noted that there were 10 objects coming from different directions and speeds and that they all ended up at the exact same spot.
content.summary: 10 orange orbs fly to same location from different directions

content.detailedDescription:
I want to share a sighting with you. hopefully, other people will contact you about this unusual sighting. please pardon my terrible grammar.
i live on south hill in minot. i'm about 13 miles away from minot air force base. from my house i can see and hear bigger and louder planes flying near the base if the weather conditions are right. last night, july 4th, the weather was good. visibility was stated to be 10 miles. in practical terms it was unlimited. there was some thin altostratus clouds in the area.
at 10:49 pm local time i was outside looking due north at some fireworks and i noticed a very bright orange colored orb. i first thought it was a firework mortar that had been fired as was waiting for it to burst. but the orb grew in intensity and was moving horizontally. i first noticed it about 30 degrees above the horizon and coming from the same area as the base. the object crossed almost overtop of me. i would guess about 70 to 80 degrees above the horizon. it was traveling extremely fast and headed sse and about 170 degrees. it was much faster then any satellite or jet i've ever witnessed. it appeared to be many times brighter then then iss or venus at their brightest apparent magnitude. it was solid in orange color and had steady brightness and having somewhat of a sparkle to it. possible due to the atmosphere. it had no fiery tail like a meteor. i couldn't see any airplane position lighting or strobes. it was somewhat oblong. its seemed to have length. it was not round like a satellite appears to be. i tracked it on its southerly heading until it went above a small cloud. it then faded very quickly in the clear just like a satellite going into the earth's shadow. i'm guessing it was 50 degrees above the horizon when it disappeared. total observation time was about 2 minutes or less. the speed and bright fiery orange were remarkable. i'm a pilot (not current) and have done much satellite observation. i know cloud movement can play tricks on apparent speed. the clouds were not moving very fast last night and i think the high speed was real.
i did not hear any noise at all from the object. there wasn't much wind or much noise from the fireworks either. i usually can hear the noise of commercial jets passing overhead at cruise altitude. i did hear one commercial jet overhead a short time after the sighting.  so, the conditions were right for me to hear something from the object. i didn't hear anything, it was completely silent.
sometime later, i not sure on the time. it may have been about 10 minutes. i was looking north again and i saw another orange object in the sky. this one was in the area of the base. it was 10 or 20 degrees above the horizon. it appeared to be rapidly climbing and moving right to left. possible climbing northwest. i was thinking it would come overhead like the last one. i ran inside to get my camera and when i came outside it was gone. also, earlier this spring, about 1:00 am i spotted my first one and didn't think much about it except for the unusual orange color. this one was moving slower and was much farther to the east of minot. it faded from view like a satellite would. i thought it was to late to observe a satellite because the sun was far below the horizon.
i googled "red satellite very bright" and came up with a lot of "hits". apparently, many people are seeing the same thing. [link moved to additional evidence section/cms/tg]  there is even a video
content.summary: Fast moving orange object traveling sse at about 170 degrees.

content.detailedDescription: On july 4, 2011, i was going out my backdoor around 1030pm and noticed toward the north a small orange light, about the size and look of a very big star but with a vivid bright orange hue. i watched and it never moved, never blinked. i could not even guess at what it could have been since it looked like nothing i had ever seen. i turned and went inside to call my boyfriend and son outside to see it and by the time i came back outside it was gone. it took me no longer than 20 seconds to go inside and come back out. i dismissed it then. i continued getting ready to start a fire in our fire pit, my boyfriend and son had went back inside. then i happened to look toward the south and there it was again, this time brighter, but it still seemed to not move at all. i watched as it simply faded away, slowly. i called for my boyfriend and son again but only my son came outside, after it was gone though.  so, once again, me and my son continued with the fire and doing some things on the deck when this time it appeared again (i didnt actually see it appear, i just happened to look up again and there it was). it had moved slightly closer from the south and this time was moving from what appeared to be southwest to northeast. the orange light was like no other i have ever seen in the sky. this time my son was seeing it too. he is only seven but this time i had a witness! as it moved it slowly faded to where you could not see it anymore. we stayed outside looking for it for about an hour and never saw it again. our line of sight is not that good from our deck so it could have appeared and we just could not see it. another note, there was absolutely no noise associated with it. the entire duration from the first time i saw it until the last was maybe 30 minutes and each time it never lasted more than a minute, if that. i have seen many things in the sky in my life but never anything that could come close to this. the one thing that i will never forget is the orange color, i cannot think of anything to compare it to. the worst part is i never expected to keep seeing it so i never got photos, the events happened so fast that i was afraid if i tried to run inside after the camera i would loose it altogether. that about sums it up. thanks.
content.summary: Round with bright orange glow

content.detailedDescription: My wife and i observed three red/orange glowing spherical objects directly above. they would fade in and out, move away and towards each other sometimes merging. the movement seemed to be very deliberate and was silent. they eventually faded out one by one. the last one took a little longer and seemed to flicker various colors before disappearing completely. very strange experience. pretty sure they weren't chinese lanterns. too high, too bright and the movement seemed intentional and swift.
content.summary: Three fire orange glowing oblects

content.detailedDescription:
They are two "star"like objects closer to the ground than stars.
i have seen them about a week prior to this sighting(june 24th or 25th) they were stationary the first time,a bright light caught my attention i turned my head to see the light and there were the two "stars",before i could react they faded away,kind of like watching a light bulb slowly dim out and they did it at the same time. lasted maybe a minute.
last night they moved across the sky together close to the same spot they were last seen a week before that.
they didnt stay long enough for me to get pictures either time:(
content.summary: Second time i have seen these two

content.detailedDescription:
I went to the fireworks and while waiting for the fireworks to start i heard a man and his wife arguing over weather or not the thing they were looking at was a star. the wife said its not a star its moving! and the husband said it is so a star! i then focused on my own kids who were asking me when the fireworks were going to start. i forgot all about what they had said and never got up to see what they were looking at (there were trees between us )
that was around 10 minutes after 9pm i believe. after the fireworks which dint start until like 930 we went to our car. i got in and looked up to see the stars as i have a million times before. i then saw a bright orange light that looked like a flame. i squinted my eyes thinking i was seeing things. it was hovering in one spot and looked like it was on fire. it was at least twice as big as the stars around it and hard to describe the shape because it was like round with a flame. i was describing it to my fiance who could not look at it because he was in the drivers side trying to wait for a chance to pull out into traffic. then it started moving east about the speed of an airplane and faded from the big orange flame into a tiny white star looking light all in a matter of  a few seconds. i couldn't see it after that because we pulled out into traffic and drove away and i was stuck in the car.
content.summary: Flame like orange ufo seen before and after fireworks hovering and then left moving east and faded
